question.title: Trying to start a Java and React app from a bash script, but keep getting the same error when executing the script
question.body:
Im trying to run this Java app with Spring boot from a script file, the script first connects to a postgreSQL database, then runs the backend and then the frontend made with React of the app.

This is the script file:

chmod +x start.sh
set -e

echo "Starting App"

PG_USER="postgres"
PG_DB="notes_db"
PG_PASS="1234"


PGREADY=$(PGPASSWORD=$PG_PASS psql -U $PG_USER -d $PG_DB -h localhost -c '\q' 2>&1 || true)
if [[ $PGREADY == *"could not connect"* ]]; then
echo "PostgreSQL is not running or credentials are incorrect."
exit 1
fi

echo "Database Initialized."

echo "Starting Backend"
cd backend
chmod +x mvnw
./mvnw clean install
./mvnw spring-boot:run
BACKEND_PID=$!
cd ..

echo "Installing frontend dependencies"
cd frontend
npm install

echo "Starting React app"
npm start &
FRONTEND_PID=$!
cd ..

echo "Everything is running."
echo "Frontend: http://localhost:3000"
echo "Backend:  http://localhost:8080/notes"

trap "kill $BACKEND_PID $FRONTEND_PID" INT TERM

wait

When it reaches to the backend section, it runs a script called mvwn which should download a .jar file from this url:https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/takari/maven-wrapper/0.5.6/

However, i keep getting this error when running the mvwn bash file:

$ MVNW_VERBOSE=true ./mvnw -v
Couldn't find .mvn/wrapper/maven-wrapper.jar, downloading it ...
Downloading from: https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/takari/maven-wrapper/0.5.6/maven-wrapper-0.5.6.jar
Found curl ... using curl
curl: (3) URL rejected: Malformed input to a URL function
/c/Users/Nicol√°s/Desktop/Java/Full Stack Implementation Exercise/backend
Error: Could not find or load main class org.apache.maven.wrapper.MavenWrapperMain
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.maven.wrapper.MavenWrapperMain

Supposedly, this is because the url is wrong inside my program, but its correctly defined inside my files, even manually downloading the file didnt help, it still tries to download it and fails at it.

The mvnw file is long, but if needed i will send it here aswell, this is the section which downloads the file.

if [ "$MVNW_VERBOSE" = true ]; then
  echo "Couldn't find .mvn/wrapper/maven-wrapper.jar, downloading it ..."
fi
if [ -n "$MVNW_REPOURL" ]; then
  jarUrl="$MVNW_REPOURL/io/takari/maven-wrapper/0.5.6/maven-wrapper-0.5.6.jar"
else
  jarUrl="https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/takari/maven-wrapper/0.5.6/maven-wrapper-0.5.6.jar"
fi
while IFS="=" read key value; do
  case "$key" in (wrapperUrl) jarUrl="$value"; break ;;
  esac
done < "$BASE_DIR/.mvn/wrapper/maven-wrapper.properties"
if [ "$MVNW_VERBOSE" = true ]; then
  echo "Downloading from: $jarUrl"
fi
wrapperJarPath="$BASE_DIR/.mvn/wrapper/maven-wrapper.jar"
if $cygwin; then
  wrapperJarPath=`cygpath --path --windows "$wrapperJarPath"`
fi

if command -v wget > /dev/null; then
    if [ "$MVNW_VERBOSE" = true ]; then
      echo "Found wget ... using wget"
    fi
    if [ -z "$MVNW_USERNAME" ] || [ -z "$MVNW_PASSWORD" ]; then
        wget "$jarUrl" -O "$wrapperJarPath"
    else
        wget --http-user=$MVNW_USERNAME --http-password=$MVNW_PASSWORD "$jarUrl" -O "$wrapperJarPath"
    fi
elif command -v curl > /dev/null; then
    if [ "$MVNW_VERBOSE" = true ]; then
      echo "Found curl ... using curl"
    fi
    if [ -z "$MVNW_USERNAME" ] || [ -z "$MVNW_PASSWORD" ]; then
        curl -o "$wrapperJarPath" "$jarUrl" -f
    else
        curl --user $MVNW_USERNAME:$MVNW_PASSWORD -o "$wrapperJarPath" "$jarUrl" -f
    fi

question_comments.body: Okay i solved it by changing the way the database was being checked inside the file and using mvn spring:boot run, still thanks for the answers.

copy/paste both scripts into shellcheck.net, fix the issues it'll tell you about, and then ask a new question with a minimal reproducible example version of the corrected code if you still have a problem.

This needs to install all dependencies to run the program aswell, thats why i need to use the wrapper, also i commented the lines  /mvnw clean install /mvnw spring-boot:run And changed it to a simple mvn spring-boot:run and it runs, but only the backend part, it doesnt say antything about starting the frontend
What happens if you run the mvnw script without your wrapper? (Is your wrapper relevant to the problem?)
